value: ) is small and is located 12 km outside the city. As of January 2014, the only flight is from

5 times a week (except Wednesdays and Saturdays). Price is 6000 RUB. Airport is connected with the city by bus 117V, which only runs once, when the flight arrives and departs. If you miss this bus, to get on another you'll have to walk 1,5km south to Petrozavodsk - Suoyarvi highway, where there are buses to Petrozavodsk approximately every 45 minutes.

The city is easily reached by train and is located nine hours north-east of
. The are both day and night trains leaving from
station, a second class sleeper ticket will set you back about 1100 RUB. Moscow is 16 hours away on a over-night service, trains depart from the
station with second class tickets costing from 2200 RUB. All trains bound for
makes stop-overs here so there are long-distance connections with
(24 h) and seasonal trains from Black Sea resorts as
(55 h) which serves mostly tourists getting home. Slow regional trains also connects with various smaller cities in Karelia such as

(4 h).

There are bus services from Saint Petersburg daily with
on Fridays and Sundays. Buses departs from the railway station at 7AM and arrives in Petrozavodsk at 8:30PM. There is also a bus service from

leaving the railway station at 8PM each Monday and Friday and arriving 8:30PM. A one-way ticket costs €40, return €75.

Petrozavodsk is along the
highway, also known as Kola Highway which links Saint Petersburg and Murmansk. The road is mostly in good condition but expect long driving distances and few gas stations along the way.

The town has a moderate size. Center is easily walkable.  A taxi anywhere in town costs 100 Rubles or less.  Buses run frequently along the major routes.

The railway station is located at the southern end of Leninsky Prospekt, which cuts through the center of town all the way to the embankment on Lake Onego.  It is about a 30 minute walk from the station to the lake.

value: The lake, the shore, and things nearby
Visit the main theater. The architecture is gorgeous and the square along with a nearby park offer great walking opportunities
content=If you are visiting in the autumn, consider joining the locals as they head into the woods to pick delicious mushrooms and berries.
content=This large outdoor marketplace has many typical food and wares vendors. In the autumn this is a good place to get fresh mushrooms, berries, fruit and vegetables.
content=Find a friendly local guide and go fishing at one of thousands of nearby lakes with an overnight stay or without.
content=Check out one of several local restaurants. Many trend foreign but some still serve local cuisine. Karelian dining often features fish cooked whole in its own soup.
content=While not as impressive as the Niagara Falls, Kivach is close by and is worth seeing if you have the time.
content=This area houses several natural springs which are said to be very good for your health. There are also resorts nearby.
content=A hydrofoil can take you to this gem in Lake Onega. While there, admire the architecture and the island.

content=Karelian birch is of particular beauty and skilled artists add to its value as well. Avoid buying any antiques (especially of military character such as medals) that could be considered of cultural value by the Customs.
content=They make great presents at home and can be a replacement for photos that might be hard to take such as Kizhi (if you don't happen to get out on the island).
directions=Northeast of the railway station, about a 45 minute walk or 10 minute bus ride
content=A new well-run hotel with several amenities, including gym, spa, restaurant, and a helpful tourism department that runs tours to Kizhi.  Part of the Best Eastern Hotels group.
directions=On the lake side of the ferry terminal building

content=A small but clean hotel close to the ferry dock.  Good for early risers who want to catch the first boat to Kizhi in the morning.  It is a little hard to find; the door faces the lake, not the street, and one must ring the bell to be admitted, then the reception desk is up the stairs.
directions=Halfway between the railway station and the lake, about a 15 minute walk from the station
content=An older but decently-maintained hotel in the downtown area, closer to the railway station than the other hotels.  Part of the Intourist Hotels group.

| small hotel on a boat, 300 m walk to the right from the ferry dock, then across a small bridge, near hotel Karelia (by car)| price=R 900 per night for a single (4 rooms share 2 baths), pleasant and clean, 24 hours
